description: Japanese painted fern is a unique and beautiful fern, known for its vivid and stunning red-purple fronds. Its common name comes from the silvery mottled pattern it has on its leaves, making it look like it has been painted on! Its low, prostrate habit combines well with other plants, both in the garden and in containers. Its adaptable nature means it will tolerate both moist and dry conditions and wide ranges of temperatures. Its foliage also changes seasonally, adding an ever-changing beauty to the landscape. A dynamic and attractive part of the garden, Japanese painted fern is an amazing plant.
